steps.text: Beat the eggs with salt and pepper. Heat a non-stick pan with a small amount of oil over low heat, then pour in the beaten eggs.
tips: Use low heat to keep the omelette soft and tender.
Tilt and swirl the pan gently to help the egg cook evenly.

steps.text: Dice the bell peppers and ham/bacon. Melt a little butter in a pan and sauté the filling ingredients until fragrant.
tips: Do not overcook the filling to keep the vegetables crisp.
Add mushrooms if you want more flavor.

steps.text: When the omelette surface is half-set, add the sautéed filling on one side of the omelette.
tips: Do not wait until the omelette is fully cooked, or it will not fold nicely.

steps.text: Fold the omelette gently over the filling. Turn off the heat and let it sit for a few seconds before serving.
tips: A true French omelette should remain tender and slightly moist inside.
Sprinkle black pepper or herbs on top for extra flavor.
